Issues.Title: Tailwind warns when using `@tailwind` within a native cascade layer
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tailwind warns when using `@tailwind` within a native cascade layer" (#10216)

Issues.Title: Don't prefix classes in arbitrary variants
Issues.Body:
We were incorrectly prefixing classes in arbitrary variants _if_ the first variant wasn't an arbitrary variant. Additionally, if the first variant was arbitrary then _all_ classes in all variants would end up un-prefixed. For example: ```html
test
test
``` These would result in the selectors: ``` .foo .group:hover .\[\.foo_\&\]\:group-hover\:tw-underline .tw-group:hover .tw-foo .group-hover\:\[\.foo_\&\]\:tw-underline ``` Notice how: 1. The first one doesn't have the `group` class prefixed like it should. 2. The second has the `foo` class prefixed when it should not. Here we rework the functions `finalizeSelector` and `formatVariantSelector` together to take multiple formats. They were previously using a mix for AST and string-based parsing. This now does the full transformation using the selector AST, parses the format strings AST as early as possible, and is set up to parse them only once for a given set of rules. All of this will allow considering metadata on a per format string basis. For instance, we now know if the format string `.foo &` was produced by a normal variant or by an arbitrary variant. We use this information to control the prefixing behavior for individual format strings. Fixes #10125
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Don't prefix classes in arbitrary variants" (#10214)

Issues.Title: CSS conflict: applies the same CSS properties as
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/5749 How to overcome css conflits in tailwind css Example : What if i wanted to add both underline and line-through using tailwind-css In css you can style it as: text-decoration-line: underline line-through; But in tailwind it produces css conflict error.
hello
Is there a way were i can force css to have both the properties of line-through and underline at the same time without using css class, just by tailwind-css class
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CSS conflict: applies the same CSS properties as" (#10209)

Issues.Title: CSS conflict: applies the same CSS properties as

### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/5749 How to overcome css conflits in tailwind css Example : What if i wanted to add both underline and line-through using tailwind-css In css you can style it as: text-decoration-line: underline line-through; But in tailwind it produces css conflict error.
hello
Is there a way were i can force css to have both the properties of line-through and underline at the same time without using css class, just by tailwind-css class
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CSS conflict: applies the same CSS properties as" (#10208)

Issues.Title: Adding custom colours to https://salient.tailwindui.com/ breaks the CSS
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "^3.2.1"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"postcss-focus-visible": "^6.0.4",
"build": "next build",
 "next": "13.0.2",

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.12.1


**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

mac

**Reproduction URL**

Your own salient template - try adding custom colors to the tailwind.config.js

**Describe your issue**

I just purchased your template code. I downloaded it, ran yarn, and yarn dev, and loaded the template. 

Then, consistent with the theme customisation [documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/adding-custom-styles), I tried to add colors to the config as follows:

```
colors: {
      'blue': '#1fb6ff',
      'pink': '#ff49db',
      'orange': '#ff7849',
      'green': '#13ce66',
      'gray-dark': '#273444',
      'gray': '#8492a6',
      'gray-light': '#d3dce6',
    },
```

This results in the CSS breaking in the template code. The margins of the containers are thrown out, the testimonials section is made subject to enormous quotation marks, the colors are not used. If I delete this code from the theme, these issues are removed. It doesn't make any difference if I change the hex values of the colours or otherwise.

Are the templates out of date? Can they be made to work with tailwind css?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adding custom colours to https://salient.tailwindui.com/ breaks the CSS" (#10207)

Issues.Title: Brave Browser animate-pulse class does not work properly
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v8.30.0

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

 Next.js v13.0.5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.17.0

**What browser are you using?**

Brave Browser

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/animation

**Describe your issue**

In Brave browser the pulse animation that is supposed to change the opacity from 100% to 50% and then back to 100% for some reason appears to be a blue outline around the object.

In all other browsers the animation works fine.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Brave Browser animate-pulse class does not work properly" (#10200)

Issues.Title: Custom class causing wrong error
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Astro 1.6.13

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

node 16.70

**What browser are you using?**

Brave / chrome / firefoxxxxx

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/LuN2ZO0DN0

**Describe your issue**

I've added a custom font to the site, and want to use it on occasion.
When making a simple class with the font name included, it works fine, but if I make a `@layer base` and create a real custom class, and then use `@apply font-class-name` things get strange.

I get an error saying that custom class doesnt exist.
Go to the declaration and delete the `@apply font-class-name` and save - the project loads fine
Go and put that rule in again - the site loads fine.

Now, if I stop the dev server, I'll get the error again when starting it.
To solve it I again delete, save, and undelete, save.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom class causing wrong error" (#10184)

Issues.Title: flex + divide-x is incorrect on RTL
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

```
"postcss": "8.4.20",
"next": "13.1.1",
```

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.4.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/uGu893pb62

**Describe your issue**

While using divide-x with flex, it doesn't play nicely on RTL.

Expected:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10504365/209668617-5031cb6f-93cd-45fc-9ef5-50a2af23318d.png)


Actual:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10504365/209668635-12e9b985-0e88-444c-9d8b-96559cd17e7f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "flex + divide-x is incorrect on RTL" (#10179)

Issues.Title: `print` modifiers seem to be lost when print orientation changes
Issues.Body:
I'm trying to use the `print` modifier to hide certain parts of my UI when the user tries to print the page i.e. `print:hidden`.

This preview in the dialogue looks as expected when I first press print. However, if I switch the orientation to landscape, everything seems to become visible again. Switch back to portrait and it's all hidden again.

Any ideas?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`print` modifiers seem to be lost when print orientation changes" (#10174)

Issues.Title: CSS animation not working
Issues.Body: I have made a  custom animation which works perfectly when i throw it against any HTML element as a class, problem starts when i try to add it to a element using JavaScript, like element.classList.add("animation-name"), it does not work? any idea of what i am doing wrong
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CSS animation not working" (#10171)

Issues.Title: Add logical properties support for inline direction
Issues.Body:
This PR introduces support for [logical properties](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties) in the inline direction for all relevant existing utilities, making it easier to build sites that support LTR and RTL layouts without having to use the `rtl:` variant when you simply need to mirror the styles. | New class | Properties | Physical counterpart (LTR) | | -------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- | | `start-*` | `inset-inline-start` | `left-*` | | `end-*` | `inset-inline-end` | `right-*` | | `ms-*` | `margin-inline-start` | `ml-*` | | `me-*` | `margin-inline-end` | `mr-*` | | `ps-*` | `padding-inline-start` | `pl-*` | | `pe-*` | `padding-inline-end` | `pr-*` | | `rounded-s-*` | `border-start-start-radius`
`border-end-start-radius` | `rounded-l-*` | | `rounded-e-*` | `border-start-end-radius`
`border-end-end-radius` | `rounded-l-*` | | `rounded-ss-*` | `border-start-start-radius` | `rounded-tl-*` | | `rounded-se-*` | `border-start-end-radius` | `rounded-tr-*` | | `rounded-ee-*` | `border-end-end-radius` | `rounded-br-*` | | `rounded-es-*` | `border-end-start-radius` | `rounded-bl-*` | | `border-s-*` | `border-inline-start-width` | `border-l-*` | | `border-e-*` | `border-inline-end-width` | `border-r-*` | | `border-s-*` | `border-inline-start-color` | `border-l-*` | | `border-e-*` | `border-inline-end-color` | `border-r-*` | | `scroll-ms-*` | `scroll-margin-inline-start` | `scroll-ml-*` | | `scroll-me-*` | `scroll-margin-inline-end` | `scroll-mr-*` | | `scroll-ps-*` | `scroll-padding-inline-start` | `scroll-pl-*` | | `scroll-pe-*` | `scroll-padding-inline-end` | `scroll-pr-*` | ## Considerations **This PR is limited to supporting the inline direction only**, as supporting the block direction introduces potential naming collisions that make the API design more challenging, for example is `mb-2` for `margin-bottom` or `margin-block`? After a bunch of research and talking to people in the community, I'm convinced that in practice supporting the block direction has far fewer benefits than supporting the inline direction, so I've opted to support just the inline direction for now to avoid being blocked on the API and get this feature shipped so people can start benefitting from it today. We can always introduce support for the block direction separately in the future ‚Äî no need for them to be introduced together and slow down the process. Right now we are using the shortest names possible like `ps-*` but if we eventually add block support and feel like that's too ambiguous, we can always support a more verbose version like `p-is-*` so that the block direction equivalent can be `p-bs-*`. My gut is that the block direction stuff will be needed so infrequently that simply making the block direction more verbose and keeping the inline ones terse is actually going to be the better trade-off though. **This PR does not include support for the logical values of `clear` or `float`**, as browser support is currently poor. We can of course revisit this in the future and add them another day when support is better.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add logical properties support for inline direction" (#10166)

Issues.Title: npx tailwindcss .... --watch is locking my files
Issues.Body:
I've installed the latest version of Tailwind (December 2022) and am using this guide : 
https://chrissainty.com/adding-tailwind-css-v3-to-a-blazor-app/

using this command: 
**npx tailwindcss -i ./app.css -o ./wwwroot/css/app.css --watch**

While editing the Blazor files, the Powershell terminal compiles my CSS and is somewhat working fine. 

However - at some point i can't save the Razor / CSHTML files in Visual Studio because the files are locked by NPX / Node 
I then have to close Powershell / Tailwind builder to save my files. 

Ultimately - i would much rather like to work with a pre-compiled subset version of Tailwind but have had a hard time finding the right way to select which features i want. That way i would have functioning Intellisense in Visual Studio.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "npx tailwindcss .... --watch is locking my files " (#10163)

Issues.Title: Styling Not Being Applied in NextJS-13
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/9936
Originally posted by **MattHeslington** November 25, 2022 Hello, I'm experiencing a really strange issue with the experimental version of NextJs13 whereby styling is not being applied despite the rules being present in the static stylesheet. I have tried both the TS and JS implementations of Next, and have tried different browsers too. I've folowed both the instructions on the Tailwind site, and those on the Next site for implementing Tailwind. Nothing has worked correctly. Here we can see a div with 3 Tailwind classes, but only font-bold is being honoured: ![Screenshot 2022-11-25 at 19 17 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8208896/203975210-7c8343fa-8a51-42a1-af41-4448d7a99948.jpg) I thought that maybe there was an issue with the classes not being compiled, but looking at the static stylesheet, they are there: ![Screenshot 2022-11-25 at 19 16 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8208896/203975444-53ab2f1f-347c-4749-99cc-09f5fd56704f.jpg) The only way I can get the classes to show is to manually reload or refresh the browser, but obviously this isn' t ideal in a large app. I have raised this in a discussion on the Next repo, but have received no answers as yet. Does anyone know what's causing this, please? Cheers, Matt
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Styling Not Being Applied in NextJS-13" (#10161)

Issues.Title: Drop Node.js 12 from workflows because of EOL
Issues.Body: IDK if this question was already discussed, but since [Node.js 12 entered EOL since 30 April 2022](https://nodejs.org/es/blog/release/v12.22.12/), does the project have a reason to still use it on workflows?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Drop Node.js 12 from workflows because of EOL" (#10153)

Issues.Title: Upgrade postcss-import: 14.1.0 ‚Üí 15.1.0 (major)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è postcss-import (14.1.0 ‚Üí 15.1.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/postcss/postcss-import) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/postcss/postcss-import/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

15.1.0 (from changelog)

  • Add data: URL support (this is not useful for most consumers) (#515)

15.0.1 (from changelog)

  • Preserve layer in ignored @imports (#510, #511)
  • Join media queries in the correct order (#512, #513)

15.0.0 (from changelog)

  • BREAKING: Require Node.js v14+ (#497)
  • BREAKING: Require nameLayer option for handling anonymous layers (#496)
  • Fix handling of @media queries inside layered imports (#495, #496)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 19 commits:

  • 15.1.0
  • add data url support (#515)
  • 15.0.1
  • Correctly sort media queries before joining them (#513)
  • Preserve layer in ignored import statements (#511)
  • Update dependency prettier to ~2.8.0 (#508)
  • Update test results for PostCSS 8.4.19 (#507)
  • Update dependency ava to v5 (#506)
  • Update dependency eslint-config-problems to v7 (#504)
  • Update tests results for postcss v8.4.17 (#503)
  • 15.0.0
  • Disable package-lock.json
  • Use optional chaining syntax
  • Update dependency ava to v4 (#478)
  • Update eslint & eslint-config-problems (#474)
  • BREAKING: Require Node v14+ (#497)
  • Fix import with layer; add nameLayer option (#496)
  • Update dependency prettier to ~2.7.0 (#494)
  • Update readme with layer example (#489)

Issues.Title: Custom RGBA value formatting error
Issues.Body:
There's friction with some bundlers like esbuild https://github.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2763.
As potential workaround we could use `bg-[rgba(193_195_201/0.7)]` but tailwind doesn't recognize custom bg value in that format.

tailwindcss@3.0.16
esbuild@0.16.10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom RGBA value formatting error" (#10138)

Issues.Title: Arbitrary values such as `min-h-[100px]` not working with imports
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v.3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js v13

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16

**Reproduction URL**

https://codesandbox.io/s/using-tailwind-with-next-js-forked-8urvz8?file=/package.json

**Describe your issue**

It seems that arbitrary values such as `min-h-[100px]` do not work in an environment where tailwind CSS utilities are imported, as opposed to generic utilities such as `min-h-0`. 

In the example I've added above, the arbitrary utility is not recognized, while a generic one targets `min-height: 0` correctly.

I could not reproduce the same issue on the tailwind playground, I suspect it might be related to Nextjs built-in PostCSS support.

Related to #6995.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Arbitrary values such as `min-h-[100px]` not working with imports" (#10130)

Issues.Title: Missing `aria-invalid` selector
Issues.Body:
I am using the latest version of Tailwind and I think `aria-invalid` is missing

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-invalid
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing `aria-invalid` selector" (#10127)

Issues.Title: Trouble building the next web application because of `Fixed-range breakpoints`
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

`v3.2.4`

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

`postcss 8.4.20, Next.js 13.0.7`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`v16.14.0`

**What browser are you using?**

`browser independent`

**What operating system are you using?**

`Windows 10 (wsl2)`

**Reproduction URL**

<https://play.tailwindcss.com/jYjWUkCEGc?file=config>

**Describe your issue**

`error - ./node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/css-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[1]!./node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/postcss-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[2]!./styles/globals.css
TypeError: value.match is not a function`

In playtailwindcss:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13795765/208615738-fa8a1c09-14e1-4f97-a36d-8e3744f3b2ce.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Trouble building the next web application because of `Fixed-range breakpoints`" (#10126)

Issues.Title: `prefix` option + `modifier` + `arbitrary variant`: extra prefix is generated for classes inside variant
Issues.Body:
`prefix: "tw-",` + `hover:[&.header-is-scrolled_.menu-list_a]:tw-text-[#FF0000]` generates: ```CSS .hover\:\[\&\.header-is-scrolled_\.menu-list_a\]\:tw-text-\[\#FF0000\].tw-header-is-scrolled .tw-menu-list a:hover { --tw-text-opacity: 1; color: rgb(255 0 0 / var(--tw-text-opacity)); } ``` expected result: ```CSS .hover\:\[\&\.header-is-scrolled_\.menu-list_a\]\:tw-text-\[\#FF0000\].header-is-scrolled .menu-list a:hover { --tw-text-opacity: 1; color: rgb(255 0 0 / var(--tw-text-opacity)); } ``` # [Tailwind Play Link](https://play.tailwindcss.com/kuo2fGhMiZ) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5171262/208573193-a916f1a3-0efc-4064-99a9-f9b33fa8de3f.png) ```HTML
abc<-
abc
abc
abc
abc
abc
abc
abc<-
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`prefix` option + `modifier` + `arbitrary variant`: extra prefix is generated for classes inside variant" (#10125)
